H0.text: Ashkenazic and sephardic cuisines are associated with which ethnic group. Arab

H1.text: Ashkenazic and sephardic cuisines are associated with which ethnic group. Greek

H2.text: Ashkenazic and sephardic cuisines are associated with which ethnic group. Turkish

H3.text: Ashkenazic and sephardic cuisines are associated with which ethnic group. Jew

A4.text: Jewish cuisine refers to the worldwide cooking traditions of the Jewish people.

A5.text: Since the rise of Ashkenazi Jewish migration to 19th-century Palestine and the establishment of the State of Israel, increased contact between Ashkenazi, Sephardi and Mizrahi Jews has led to a rising importance of Middle-Eastern and Mediterranean cuisine amongst Jews of all backgrounds.
